snippet: The Yemeni government said Tuesday that the army had driven out militants linked to Al Qaeda from two of their strongholds in southern Yemen.
abstract: Yemeni government announces that the army has driven out militants linked to Al Qaeda from their southern strongholds of Jaar and Zinjibar; southern region has become a focal point of American concerns about terrorism.
lead_paragraph: The Yemeni government said Tuesday that the army had driven out militants linked to Al Qaeda from two of their strongholds in southern Yemen.

headline.seo: Yemeni Forces Drive Militants From 2 Cities
headline.main: Yemen Says Militants Are Driven From 2 Cities
headline.print_headline: Yemen Says Militants Are Driven From 2 Cities
